column1: Art Institute of Chicago////What they have is mindboggling -- well preserved
column3: glorious. There's little between you and the art that you are seeing
column4: explanations however are freely provided by the docents. I can't help but think that grabbing a Chicago tourism guide is almost a necessity. To see it all
column5: you have to rush or excise areas. Don't do that with medieval: there's some absolute treasures that will redefine the "Dark Ages
column6: a term that's fallen out of favour. The age of cathedral building also made immaculate miniatures and religious icons.
